Agent

Source: R/agent.R
Agent.Rd

The R6 class Agent is responsible for the state, flow of information between and the running of one Bandit and Policy pair. As such, multiple Agents can be run in parallel with each separate Agent keeping track of t and the parameters in named list theta for its assigned Policy and Bandit pair.

Usage

agent <- Agent$new(policy, bandit)

Arguments

policy

A Policy object, expected to take into account the current d dimensional context feature vector X, together with a limited set of parameters denoted theta (summarizing all past actions), to choose one of the k arms of its corresponding bandit's arms at each time step t.

bandit

A Bandit object, responsible for both the generation of d dimensional context vectors X and the k I.I.D. distributions each generating a reward for each of its k arms at each time step t.

Methods

set_t(t)

Setter function, sets the state of the state variable holding the current time step t.

do_step()

Completes one time step t by consecutively calling bandit$get_context(), policy$get_action(), bandit$get_reward() and policy$set_reward().

See also

Core contextual classes: Simulator, Agent, History, Plot

Bandit classes: Bandit, BasicBandit, LiSamplingOfflineBandit, SyntheticBandit

Other contextual: History, Plot, Simulator, plot.history, print.history, summary.history
